alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:53AM CDT until May 08 at 9:48PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Cherokee and Crawford. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 AM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pittsburg, Baxter Springs, Columbus, Girard, Frontenac, Galena, Arma and Cherokee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
